thread.title: Britain's youngest EuroMillions winner misses flight home from partying in Tenerife after claiming £1m windfall 'ruined her life'
thread.title_full: Britain's youngest EuroMillions winner misses flight home from partying in Tenerife after claiming £1m windfall 'ruined her life'

author: Chris Baynes
title: Britain's youngest EuroMillions winner misses flight home from partying in Tenerife after claiming £1m windfall 'ruined her life'
text:
News Britain's youngest EuroMillions winner misses flight home from partying in Tenerife after claiming £1m windfall 'ruined her life' Jane Park, 21, was stranded on the Spanish island after getting "melted" celebrating her beloved football team Hibernian's win over Hearts in the Edinburgh derby Share Jane Park won £1m in the EuroMillions lottery as a 17-year-old (Photo: PA) Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
A young EuroMillions winner who complained becoming a millionaire had ruined her life missed her flight home from Tenerife after a wild night out. 
Jane Park , 21, was stranded on the Spanish island after getting "melted" celebrating her beloved football team Hibernian's win over Hearts in the Edinburgh derby. 
The Scot streamed the match on Periscope while on last-minute mini-break with a pal. 
She tweeted the next day: "Went out n got melted n missed my flight Hahahahahhaha mon eh hibs." Read More Jane Park claimed winning the lottery had made her life 'misery' (Photo: Sunday Mirror) 
Hours earlier she had written: "A should b sleeping." 
Miss Park became Britain's youngest EuroMillions winner at the age of 17 when she scooped £1million with her first ever ticket. 
Earlier this month she bizarrely threatened to sue Camelot, which runs the lottery in the UK, claiming she was too young to handle such riches. 
She said: "At times it feels like winning the lottery has ruined my life. 
"I wish I had no money most days. I say to myself, ‘My life would be so much easier if I hadn’t won.’ Read More Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Britain's youngest Euromillions winner has regret over Lotto win Share this video Watch Next 
“People look at me and think, ‘I wish I had her lifestyle, I wish I had her money.’ But they don’t realise the extent of my stress." 
But there were few signs of stress as Miss Park posted pictures and videos of her partying in Tenerife. 
While on the Canary Island she also got a new tattoo to celebrate her favourite team's famous 3-2 victory over Rangers in last year's Scottish Cup final. 
She tweeted a picture of fresh ink reading "21/05/16" - the date of the match - beneath the words "Hibs every weekend". Read More Britain's youngest Euromillions winner wants to SUE Lotto for ruining her life with big win She got a Hibs tattoo to celebrate their famous cup win (Photo: @janeparkx/Twitter) 
Last week the moaning millionaire was slammed by viewers for complaining about life after her lottery win on ITV's Loose Women. 
She said: "I never realised how difficult it would be. I thought everything would be amazing. 
"But, at times, it's completely different to how you’d expect." 
One viewer tweeted: "Won a million and now complaining and wanting to sue camelot. Grow up. #LooseWomen." 
Another agreed: "She cant seriously expect the National Lottery to be held accountable for her lifestyle. This is ridiculous!" Read More Brit wins whopping £14.5million jackpot on EuroMillions just days after another UK winner scooped £20million Jane Park has been mocked for whingeing about her millions (Photo: @janeparkx/Twitter) 
Camelot appointed a financial adviser to help Miss Park, who was working as an admin temp and living with her mum on an Edinburgh council estate when she won the windfall. 
The then-teenager still splashed out on a designer bags, £4,500 breast implants and a customised Range Rover. 
She later dropped her threat to sue Camelot. Like us on Facebook
